Sequence Information.Target Organism: No MICs found in DRAMP database
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Cationic peptide that possess multiple functions. It acts as a cell-penetrating peptide (CPP), and as a potent voltage- gated potassium channel (Kv) inhibitor. It exhibits antimicrobial activities, hind limb paralysis, and severe muscle necrosis by a non-enzymatic mechanism (By similarity).
Sequence Information.Miscellaneous: This myotoxin is the most abundant transcript in the venom of the specimen analyzed (PubMed
Sequence Information.Toxic Dose: LD(50) is 0.96 mg/kg by subcutaneous injection.(Ref.1)

Literature.Title: The venom-gland transcriptome of the eastern diamondback rattlesnake (Crotalus adamanteus).
Literature.Author: Rokyta DR, Lemmon AR, Margres MJ, Aronow K.

Literature.Title: Amino acid sequence of a myotoxin from venom of the eastern diamondback rattlesnake (Crotalus adamanteus).
Literature.Author: Samejima Y, Aoki Y, Mebs D.
